info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 3:53AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...DANGEROUS COLD TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND... Arctic air remains in place this morning with lows ranging from the low teens and single digits to well below zero where abundant snow pack resides. Expect low temperatures of -5 to -30 where snowpack persists. While winds will generally remain light into the morning hours, even 5 to 10 mph winds could generate dangerous wind chills. Despite full sun, high temperatures today are only expected to climb into the teens to mid 20s most areas. Another frigid night is on tap for tonight into early Sunday, with single digit lows again expected for many locations. While sub zero temperatures will likely occur again in some areas, they may not be as widespread tonight as cloud cover will be increasing overnight. These extremely cold temperatures can lead to rapid onset of frost bite and hypothermia for those without adequate clothing and protection from the cold. If outdoors, remember to dress in layers and cover exposed skin. Due to the prolonged nature of sub freezing temperatures, uncovered pipes will be susceptible to freezing and bursting. Take steps to ensure pipes are protected and outdoor faucets are covered. Warmer temperatures are expected heading into next week as winds become more southwesterly ahead of a series of storm systems.
